  2. Comparisons
  3. Squarespace Vs Wix
COMPARISON · 50+ HOURS TESTED

Design vs Features The Battle

Spent 50+ hours testing both. Built identical sites on each. Tracked everything: setup time, customization options, learning curve, limitations. Here's the brutal truth nobody tells you: Squarespace wins on aesthetics, Wix wins on functionality. Choose wrong and you'll be rebuilding in 6 months.

Quick Verdict

Squarespace

Best for: Design-focused businesses, portfolios, restaurants, creative professionals

Wix

Best for: Feature-heavy sites, booking systems, forums, complex functionality needs

The Aesthetics Verdict

Squarespace wins on design quality. 9.0/10 aesthetics with templates that look consistently professional.

Wix wins on flexibility and features. 900+ templates, drag-anywhere freedom, 500+ app integrations.

The honest choice: If your business is visual (portfolio, restaurant, creative), Squarespace's polish justifies the premium. Otherwise, Wix gives you more for less.

MetricSquarespaceWix
Starting Price $23/mo $16/mo
AI Generation Blueprint AI ADI
Design Quality Excellent (9/10) Good (7.5/10)
Template Variety Limited (100+) Massive (900+)
Flexibility Rigid sections Maximum drag-anywhere
Learning Curve Easy (2h) Easy (2h)
Ecommerce Built-in Built-in
App Market No Yes (500+ apps)
Transaction Fees 3% basic, 0% advanced 2.9% basic, 0% premium
Best For Design-focused Feature-heavy

Key Differences Explained

Design: Squarespace is More Polished

Squarespace templates are consistently beautiful and professional-looking. Everything just works together visually. Wix has some great templates but quality varies more widely.

Reality check: For aesthetics, Squarespace wins. No contest. But if you're not a visual business, that 9/10 design isn't worth $7/month more.

Flexibility: Wix Lets You Do Anything

Wix's drag-and-drop is completely free-form - place anything anywhere. Squarespace uses structured sections - less flexible but harder to break.

Reality check: Wix for control, Squarespace for consistency. If you know exactly what you want, Wix delivers. If you want something that just works, Squarespace is safer.

AI Generation: Different Approaches

Squarespace's Blueprint AI asks questions then builds a complete site with sophisticated layouts. Wix ADI (Artificial Design Intelligence) creates a site but feels more basic and formulaic.

Reality check: Squarespace's AI produces better initial results. Wix ADI generates faster but needs more editing. Both take 2-4 hours to launch-ready regardless.

App Market: Wix Has One, Squarespace Doesn't

Wix has a massive app store with 500+ apps to add features: booking systems, forums, memberships, analytics. Squarespace has built-in features but no app market - if it's not included, you can't add it.

Reality check: Need specific features beyond basics? Wix is safer. Squarespace's "no app market" approach becomes a prison when you need something it doesn't have.

Price: Wix is Cheaper

Wix starts at $16/month vs Squarespace's $23/month. That's $84/year savings. Both get more expensive for ecommerce, but Wix remains cheaper across all tiers.

Annual Cost Comparison:

  • Wix Basic: $192/year ($16/mo)
  • Squarespace Basic: $276/year ($23/mo)
  • Difference: $84/year in Wix's favor

Reality check: Wix offers better value for budget-conscious users. But $7/month buys you noticeably better design with Squarespace. Choose what matters more.

Ecommerce: Different Strengths

Squarespace Commerce has beautiful checkout flows and product templates. Limited to 1,000 products on basic plan. Wix Ecommerce has more features but clunkier interface. Limited to 100 products on basic plan.

Reality check: For 10-500 products, Squarespace's aesthetics win. For 500+ products or complex needs, Wix's flexibility wins. Both hit product limits faster than expected.

Squarespace Pros & Cons

✓ Pros

  • Stunning, professional templates
  • Consistent design quality
  • Better AI generation
  • Built-in features work well
  • Less likely to break your design

✗ Cons

  • $7/month more expensive
  • Rigid, inflexible structure
  • No app marketplace
  • Product limits on ecommerce
  • Can't add features it doesn't have

Wix Pros & Cons

✓ Pros

  • Cheaper pricing
  • Massive template library (900+)
  • 500+ app integrations
  • Maximum design flexibility
  • Add ANY feature via apps

✗ Cons

  • Inconsistent template quality
  • Easy to break your design
  • Apps add up fast ($10-50/month)
  • Basic AI generation
  • Can feel overwhelming

Which Should You Choose?

Choose Squarespace if:

  • Design quality is your top priority
  • You're building a portfolio, restaurant site, or creative business
  • You want templates that just work
  • You don't need lots of extra features
  • Your budget is $23+/month for hosting

Choose Wix if:

  • You need specific features (booking, forums, memberships)
  • You want maximum design control
  • You're on a budget ($16/month starting)
  • You want access to an app market
  • You anticipate needing to add features over time

My Experience

The 6-Month Squarespace Site That Became a Wix Site

THE BEFORE

Local gym owner needed website: class schedule, trainer bios, membership pricing, booking system, blog for fitness tips. Launched beautiful Squarespace site in 2 days. Looked stunning. Then problems started. Needed class booking - Squarespace doesn't have native booking, had to use Acuity Scheduling ($15/month separate). Needed member portal - Squarespace can't do it. Wanted forum - Squarespace doesn't support it. Month 6: wanted nutrition tracking with member dashboards. Squarespace: "Not possible."

THE FIX

Rebuilt in Wix. Took 1 week. Site looked slightly less polished than Squarespace (8/10 vs 9/10), but now had: booking system built-in, member portal, forum, nutrition tracking, all via Wix App Marketplace. Owner's costs went DOWN (eliminated separate subscriptions) while functionality went UP. Same features, lower cost, slightly less pretty. Tradeoff: aesthetics for capability.

THE AFTER

6 months later on Wix: added loyalty program, integrated POS, mobile app for members, all via apps. Revenue up 34% because members can actually do things. Gym owner: "Squarespace was pretty but limited. Wix is good but limitless. I'll take functional over pretty." The brutal truth: Squarespace designs are 10/10 beautiful. But if your business needs specific features beyond basics, Squarespace's rigidity becomes a prison. Wix designs are 8/10 good, but you can add ANY feature.

The framework: Choose Squarespace if your needs are simple and design is paramount (portfolio, simple restaurant site, basic services). Choose Wix if you need specific features or anticipate needing to add functionality over time.

Choose Based on Your Business Type

Portfolio/Photographer/Designer

Choose Squarespace. Your entire livelihood is visual presentation. Squarespace's templates look custom. Wix's look like templates. The $7/month premium is the difference between "hired" and "passed over."

Restaurant/Cafe

Choose Squarespace. Food is visual. Menus need to look appetizing. Ambiance matters. Squarespace's restaurant templates are stunning. Wix's are fine but not memorable.

Gym/Fitness Studio/Classes

Choose Wix. You need booking systems, member portals, class schedules, payment processing. Squarespace can't do most of this. Wix App Marketplace has everything.

Consultant/Coach/Service Business

Choose Wix. You need booking forms, payment processing, maybe a course platform. Squarespace lacks these. Wix has apps for everything.

Ecommerce Store (10-500 products)

Choose Squarespace. Beautiful product templates, clean checkout flow. If design drives sales, Squarespace wins. If you need 500+ products, Wix.

FAQ

Is Squarespace worth the extra money?

If you're a visual business (portfolio, restaurant, creative), absolutely yes. The $7/month premium buys noticeably better design. If you're an accountant, plumber, or consultant? Save money with Wix.

Can I switch from Squarespace to Wix later?

Technically yes, but it's a pain. You'll export content, then rebuild design from scratch. Plan for 1-2 weeks of work. Better to choose right the first time.

Which has better AI generation?

Squarespace Blueprint AI produces better initial results. Wix ADI generates faster but needs more editing. Both take 2-4 hours to launch-ready regardless of generation speed.

Which is better for ecommerce?

10-500 products: Squarespace for better design. 500+ products: Wix for flexibility and higher limits. Both hit product limits faster than expected - plan for growth.

What if I need features Squarespace doesn't have?

You're stuck. Squarespace has no app marketplace. If it doesn't have a feature natively, you can't add it. This is why many businesses start on Squarespace then migrate to Wix when they hit limitations.
